p: Finally, Caldas et al. (2013) presented the low repeated dose toxicity of the essential oil of Medusantha martiusii (syn. Hyptis martiusii) in mice (100 and 500Â mg/kg). This study was justified by the extensive use of this species in traditional medicine to treat gastric disorders. The results of this study demonstrated no toxicity signs or mice deaths along the 30 days as well as no differences in body weight gain.
